card.text: Designed by George Tilden of Rotch and Tilden.
Then converted to the Admission Center in 1966.
Funds for a new gymnasium began with a box placed on a table in the Boarding House dining room to receive five-cent fines for tardiness.

Had a swimming tank, 36' x 12', with depths from 7' to 4', was installed in 1913. Students called it the "Dean's Bathtub," because in it they were required to pass swimming and diving tests before graduating.
